paragraphs.body:
Is your fanon unread, unnoticed, or just in need of some advice? Do you wonder for hours and hours every day, wanting to know what makes your fanon shine? Have you needed a bit of motivation, some reception on how your stories are going?
Ask these questions no longer!
The Fanon Review Squad is a user group of knowledgeable fanon authors with extensive writing experience who will review your fanon upon request. Just go down to the bottom of the page and drop a link to your story under one of the group member's schedules. On the day that you request, we'll make a little blog post about your fanon, give it some scores, and tell some advice. And if your story is good, you'll probably get lots of new fans.

Is your fanon unread, unnoticed, or just in need of some advice? Do you wonder for hours and hours every day, wanting to know what makes your fanon shine? Have you needed a bit of motivation, some reception on how your stories are going?
Ask these questions no longer!
The Fanon Review Squad is a user group of knowledgeable fanon authors with extensive writing experience who will review your fanon upon request. Just go down to the bottom of the page and drop a link to your story under one of the group member's schedules. On the day that you request, we'll make a little blog post about your fanon, give it some scores, and tell some advice. And if your story is good, you'll probably get lots of new fans.

paragraphs.body: Applications to join the Fanon Review Squad are currently closed.
paragraphs.text: Applications to join the Fanon Review Squad are currently closed.

paragraphs.body: Once you've officially joined, you can add this brilliant little userbox to your profile page:
paragraphs.text: Once you've officially joined, you can add this brilliant little userbox to your profile page:

paragraphs.body: Just copy and paste {{User Fanon Review Squad}} onto your profile.
paragraphs.text: Just copy and paste {{User Fanon Review Squad}} onto your profile.

paragraphs.body: Being a part of the Fanon Review Squad isn't just for fun and socializing. When you join, you will be given a schedule - which you will have to organize yourself - at the bottom of the page where fanon writers may leave a link to their story, hoping for it to get reviewed. You are responsible for creating a review for that fanon in blog post form on the day that your schedule says. The format of the blog post is up to you, but please add {{FRSNotice}} at the top of each review. When you have finished, take that fanon off your schedule and put a link to the review in the "Reviews" section at the bottom of this page.
paragraphs.text: Being a part of the Fanon Review Squad isn't just for fun and socializing. When you join, you will be given a schedule - which you will have to organize yourself - at the bottom of the page where fanon writers may leave a link to their story, hoping for it to get reviewed. You are responsible for creating a review for that fanon in blog post form on the day that your schedule says. The format of the blog post is up to you, but please add {{FRSNotice}} at the top of each review. When you have finished, take that fanon off your schedule and put a link to the review in the "Reviews" section at the bottom of this page.

paragraphs.body: Former Review Squad Members
paragraphs.text: Former Review Squad Members

paragraphs.body: Being a member of Fanon Review Squad can often be challenging, as life is tough and we don't have all the time in the world to be on a tight reviewing schedule. Often, one missed review can lead to another, and sometimes we get so caught up in our reviewing we feel as though we just can't handle the work. If you need to quit the group, that's fine. We understand. However, before leaving, the following two things must be done:
paragraphs.text: Being a member of Fanon Review Squad can often be challenging, as life is tough and we don't have all the time in the world to be on a tight reviewing schedule. Often, one missed review can lead to another, and sometimes we get so caught up in our reviewing we feel as though we just can't handle the work. If you need to quit the group, that's fine. We understand. However, before leaving, the following two things must be done:

paragraphs.body: Then you can go! We'll take care of updating this page accordingly. If you are in an absolute emergency that will include leaving the FRS, tell us and exceptions can be made to the above rules.
paragraphs.text: Then you can go! We'll take care of updating this page accordingly. If you are in an absolute emergency that will include leaving the FRS, tell us and exceptions can be made to the above rules.

paragraphs.body: Does your story long for a bit of advice and popularity? Just add a link to your fanon's main page under one of the member's names below, and on the day you request they'll post a review. You can put your fanon down under multiple member's schedules, for multiple reviews, but each member can only review your fanon once. Reviews should be only for active fanons - ones that have yet to be completed. And if you ever see an open date that says "Ba Sing Se Edition", snag it fast! Those reviews will be featured in ${link_0}.
paragraphs.text: Does your story long for a bit of advice and popularity? Just add a link to your fanon's main page under one of the member's names below, and on the day you request they'll post a review. You can put your fanon down under multiple member's schedules, for multiple reviews, but each member can only review your fanon once. Reviews should be only for active fanons - ones that have yet to be completed. And if you ever see an open date that says "Ba Sing Se Edition", snag it fast! Those reviews will be featured in The Ba Sing Se Times.

paragraphs.body: Reviews featured in the BSST are chosen randomly.  Beware of this reviewer's delays if you sign up.

paragraphs.body: Current Review: Book Six: Shadow
paragraphs.text: Current Review: Book Six: Shadow

paragraphs.body: Note: My review schedule has no specific dates attached to it, and the speed at which I finish my reviews depends upon the length of the fanon, how busy I am in real life and other factors.  Nevertheless, I will make my best effort to complete your review as swiftly as possible.  In general, I follow both rules of thumb: a minimum of five chapters and a minimum of five one-shots.  If you choose to submit one-shots, you can list any combination of one-shots you like, provided that there are at least five, even if those one-shots are not otherwise related.  Ultimately, my goal is to help you improve your story and improve your writing, so I'll pack as much feedback as possible into my reviews.  You can check out my blog post on category explanations to see how I review.
paragraphs.text: Note: My review schedule has no specific dates attached to it, and the speed at which I finish my reviews depends upon the length of the fanon, how busy I am in real life and other factors. If you choose to submit one-shots, you can list any combination of one-shots you like, provided that there are at least five, even if those one-shots are not otherwise related.  Ultimately, my goal is to help you improve your story and improve your writing, so I'll pack as much feedback as possible into my reviews.  You can check out my blog post on category explanations to see how I review.

paragraphs.body: To-Do
paragraphs.text: To-Do

paragraphs.body: If you would like to have me review your fanon, then first of all, thank you. :) Feel free to add your fanon if there is a free slot under the ‘To-Do’ section. If you do see your fanon appear under the 'Current' section, then that means I have officially started reading your fanon! :) So please leave that section for me to update. I follow the rule of thumb of having five chapters or five one-shots, but if your one-shot is fairly long I may be inclined to review it individually if you prefer, so feel free to send a message and we can talk further. As for what to expect from me as a reviewer, I try to give insightful and constructive advice about your fanon and writing, which may include specific examples from your story.
paragraphs.text: If you would like to have me review your fanon, then first of all, thank you. :) Feel free to add your fanon if there is a free slot under the ‘To-Do’ section. If you do see your fanon appear under the 'Current' section, then that means I have officially started reading your fanon! :) So please leave that section for me to update. I follow the rule of thumb of having five chapters or five one-shots, but if your one-shot is fairly long I may be inclined to review it individually if you prefer, so feel free to send a message and we can talk further. As for what to expect from me as a reviewer, I try to give insightful and constructive advice about your fanon and writing, which may include specific examples from your story.

paragraphs.body: I hope that me being your reviewer will not only be helpful, but also enjoyable. If you have any questions then don't hesitate to ask. ;)
paragraphs.text: I hope that me being your reviewer will not only be helpful, but also enjoyable. If you have any questions then don't hesitate to ask. ;)
